page.title: 10LANGUAGE,KINNERTON,EVENJOBB
page.content: THE POPULATION IS COMPLETELY ENGLISH SPEAKING,NO WELSH HAS BEEN SPOKEN BY THE INDIGENOUS POPULATION FOR PROBABLY 2OO YEARS.THE DIALECT & ACCENT ARE SIMILAR TO WEST HEREFORDSHIRE,NOT WELSH AT ALL.SOME LOCAL WORDS- 'BING'-PASSAGE IN COW HOUSE 'BOUGHTEN'-GOODS BOUGHT IN A SHOP 'BRIVIT'-TO RUMMAGE AROUND FOR THINGS 'COOTCH UP'-(SHORT OO)TO CUDDLE UP 'CRATCH'-FEEDING TROUGH 'JERN'-ENERGETIC,KEEN. 'PIKEL'-PITCH FORK.'PITCH'-STEEP ROAD 'PLOCK'-PADDOCK NEAR FARMHOUSE 'QUICKS'-HAWTHORN CUTTINGS FOR A HEDGE 'SLANG'-LONG NARROW FIELD 'STARVED'-TO FEEL COLD 'A TIDY PERSON'-ONE WHO IS RESPECTABLE & DECENT. 'TROWES'-WOOD FOR FILLING HOLES IN HEDGES
